record.title: NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2008--Continued
record.narrative:
NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2008--Continued -- (Senate - September 25, 2007)

[Page: S12024]
record.chair: The clerk will report the pending business.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:

A bill (H.R. 1585) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2008 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

MOTION TO COMMIT

   AMENDMENT NO. 3038

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I send a motion to the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will report the motion.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
Motion to commit H.R. 1585 to the Committee on Armed Services with instructions to report back forthwith, with the following amendment numbered 3038:
The provisions of this Act shall become effective 3 days after enactment.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: Is there a sufficient second? There is a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I send an amendment to the motion to the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will report.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. REID] proposes an amendment numbered 3039 to the motion to commit.
The amendment is as follows:
Strike "3" and insert "2".

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: Is there a sufficient second. There is a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I send a second-degree amendment to the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will report.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. REID] proposes an amendment numbered 3040 to amendment No. 3039.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: Is there a sufficient second? There is a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that no further cloture motions in relation to this bill be in order for the remainder of the day.

record.chair: Is there objection?

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, we understand there may be the proverbial side-by-side in relation to the hate crimes matter. This means the Republicans may file their own version of hate crimes, so we will work that out. This does not apply to that.

record.chair: Is there objection?
Without objection, it is so ordered.
